content:
Add Conditions to a FlexCard Element

Display or hide data based on the value of a data field. For example, display an alert icon or supplemental text for escalated Cases.

Applying conditions works differently than with other elements. See Add Conditions to a FlexCard State.

Beginning Winter '22, apply conditions to an action on an event listener or individual actions on the Menu element.

IMPORTANT

Applied conditions are visible in Preview only.

To add a condition:

1. Select an element from the canvas and click +Add New next to Conditions in the Properties panel.
2. Click Setup, click + Add New in the Event Listener section, and click +Add New next to Conditions (for actions on event listeners).
3. Select a Menu element, select an action to edit, and click +Add New next to Conditions (for actions on Menu elements).

(Optional) Deselect the Preload Conditional Component checkbox to improve performance on conditional elements.

Click + Add Condition.
Create basic conditions:
Click Data Field, select a data field to filter.
Select an Operator from the dropdown.
In the Value field, enter the value to check against. For example, enter Escalated.
Only the Parent.attr context variable is supported for conditions on a State element in a child FlexCard.

To add another condition:

1. Click + Add Condition and select AND or OR between conditions.
2. Select AND if all conditions must be met.
3. Select OR if any condition can be met.

If needed, build nested conditions:
Click + Add Group after creating a condition.
Click + Add Condition and enter values for all fields for each condition.
Select AND or OR from the dropdown between conditions.
title: Add Conditions to a FlexCard Element
